title: Dorset and Hampshire Live: Wednesday 11 January - BBC News
summary: woman 'screamed for help ' after falling down cliff in purbeck .
met office warns rain may turn to snow in the south on thursday .
southampton bargate plan gets green light .

documents.title: southampton 1-0 liverpool
text: southampton 1-0 liverpool
author: Phil McNulty
Chief football writer

documents.title: that 's all for today !
text: thanks for joining us today .
the bbc local live service for hampshire , dorset and the isle of wight will resume at 08:00 on thursday .
you can still get in touch via email , on our hampshire and dorset facebook pages or on twitter @ bbc hampshire and @ bbcdorset .
author: Marcus White
BBC South

documents.title: snow or no snow ?
text: weather presenter alexis green says there is a `` great deal of uncertainty '' over the chance of snow in the south tomorrow .
she says : `` we have all the ingredients for snow - intense rain , cold air from the north and the right wind direction .
`` but it is less likely along the coast where it will be warmer .
more likely for areas north of the m4 .
`` the uncertainty is about the track and intensity of the weather system , meaning that confidence is low in the amount and extent of any snow . ''
author: Alexis Green
BBC South Today weather presenter

documents.title: man arrested over portsmouth assaults
text: a man has been arrested in connection with two assaults in portsmouth .
a 38-year-old man was taken to hospital with a stab wound to his leg , which was not believed to be life-threatening , following an assault in st mary 's road , portsmouth on saturday evening .
a 21-year-old man from london has been arrested on sus of wounding with intent .

he has also been arrested on sus of wounding with intent following an assault in lake road on 14 october in which a 38-year-old man suffered an injury to his neck and was taken to hospital in a critical condition .
author: Stephen Stafford
BBC South

documents.title: in the last time snow came to hampshire
text: readers sent in their snowy scene the last time hampshire was dusted in white in february 2014 .
here 's a few of our favourites as we prepare for potentially similar scenes tomorrow :

documents.title: ryde arena 'offered for sale '
text: the isle of wight council says it has been offered the chance to buy the lease of a former ice rink , which closed in october after failing to pay enough rent .
the council , which is the freeholder , says aew has offered the leasehold of ryde arena for £ 3m , and is also reported to have offered the building for sale to others .
the council has confirmed it has declared the building to be an asset of community value , potentially delaying its sale for six months .
however , it says anyone can buy the building after that time , and the delay would not apply to buildings which are already on the market .
author: Marcus White
BBC South

documents.title: 'new era ' for southampton city centre
text: southampton 's council leader said the approval of plans to redevelop the area surrounding the city 's bargate alongside the medieval town walls marked a `` new era '' for the city centre .
more than 150 flats , as well as student accommodation and shops , would be built in the queensway and east street area , with the walls the centrepiece of an open boulevard .
the regeneration plans will not only create job opportunities for locals , but the apartments will help to create a vibrant community in the city centre .
author: Stephen Stafford
BBC South

documents.title: travel : marchwood bypass reopens
text: the marchwood bypass has been reopened in both directions , more than four hours after a two-vehicle crash .
police said two people were taken to hospital but their injuries were not thought to be life-threatening .
a326 # marchwood - marchwood bypass closed in both directions between twiggs lane and dibden rbt due to rti , delays in both directions .
a326 # marchwood - marchwood bypass remains closed in both directions between twiggs lane and main road due to rti , delays .
a326 # marchwood - marchwood bypass reopened in both directions between twiggs lane and main road , delays should ease soon .
@ twitterid

documents.title: rolf harris on trial accused of assaulting 12-year-old girl in portsmouth and six other alleged victims
text: former entertainer rolf harris allegedly assaulted seven women and girls in a series of `` brazen '' attacks over a period of 30 years , a court has been told .
the 86-year old denies seven charges of indecent assault and one of sexual assault and is appearing at southwark crown court via video link .
the alleged victims were aged between 12 and 42 , the jury was told and one incident was in portsmouth .
all of the alleged assaults occurred in `` public settings '' , the court heard .
the alleged assaults , which are said to date between 1971 and 2004 , could all be described as `` unwanted groping '' , the court heard .
author: Emily Ford
BBC South

documents.title: two in hospital after marchwood crash
text: two people have been taken to hospital with injuries that are not believed to be life-threatening , following the crash which has closed the marchwood bypass .
police were called at 12:42 gmt to a two-vehicle collision .
officers say the road remains closed in both directions south of the twiggs lane junction .
author: Marcus White
BBC South

documents.title: £ 13m museum extension plans submitted
text: plans have been submitted for a major £ 13m extension and upgrade to dorset county museum .
the project , due to be completed by 2020 , aims to turn the 19th century building in dorchester into a `` world-class contemporary museum '' .
plans submitted to west dorset district council include new galleries , a learning centre , collections storage , library , facilities including a cafe and shop .
the museum is to be the first to host the the natural history museum 's diplodocus skeleton replica , which is touring from next year .
author: Roz Tappenden
BBC South

documents.title: dorchester 'not forgotten ' despite dorset echo office closure
text: our # dorchester office may have closed but we are still committed to covering news in the county town .

documents.title: ryde arena wins 'community asset ' listing
text: the isle of wight 's only ice rink , which closed in october after failing to pay enough rent , has been given a special status by the local council .
campaigners trying to save ryde arena have had it declared an asset of community value .
the arena community action group says it would delay any sale of the building or the lease for six months , while it prepares a bid .

documents.title: norovirus bug closes hospital ward
text: an outbreak of the winter vomiting bug norovirus has closed a ward at royal bournemouth hospital .
the hospital is urging friends and relatives to restrict their visits to patients .
it said ward 24 had been closed but did not disclose how many patients had contracted the illness .
it is essential to ensure the virus does not spread to other parts of our hospitals .
the safety of our patients is paramount and the cooperation of members of the public in helping this is appreciated .
we will reopen the ward as soon as it is safe to do so and when it has been thoroughly cleaned .

documents.title: eight more public toilets in poole to close
text: eight more public toilets will close in poole , the council has said .

borough of poole 's cabinet approved the move in a bid to support the council 's community toilet scheme , whereby toilet facilities in participating premises , including libraries , coffee shops and supermarkets , can be accessed - during their normal opening hours - for free .

the toilets at parkstone park , poole road and constitution hill will shut indefinitely , but the toilets at branksome recreation ground , alexandra park , the haven , baiter park ( and charborough road could be reopened in the future if a suitable group comes forward to run them , the council said .
the authority has already approved the closure of several other facilities , including at adastral square and mccauley road , in bid to save cash .

documents.title: yellow warning of snow issued for the south
text: the met office has issued a yellow warning for snow for tomorrow .

there will be a chance of snow settling tomorrow afternoon with disruption to road , rail and air services as well as interruptions to power supplies and other utilities - this more likely across east anglia and southern england .
as skies clear on thursday night there is also potential for widespread ice to form quite rapidly on untreated surfaces .

documents.title: reward to find man guilty of producing £ 200,000 worth of cocaine
text: a £ 2,000 reward has been offered to track down a man guilty of producing up to £ 200,000 worth of cocaine .
charity crimestoppers is offering the reward for information on the whereabouts of scott woods .
woods has been on the run since 2014 when he was sentenced in his absence to 12 years in jail for conspiracy to sell cocaine .
the 28-year-old was one of five men found guilty of producing cocaine but he failed to attend the trial at bournemouth crown court .
he has friends and family connections across dorset , particularly around bournemouth , poole and lulworth cove , and a european arrest warrant has been issued for his capture .

documents.title: window smashed in latest mettricks guildhall square cafe raid
text: a southampton cafe has posted of damage caused by the latest in a series of break-ins .
in june , spencer bowman , owner of mettricks in guildhall square spoke out after being targeted five times by burglars .
he said £ 100 in cash had been taken and a £ 4,000 window had been smashed in the latest raid overnight .
today will be an emotional one - when someone breaks into your family business it feels personal - when it happens over and over it wears you down .

documents.title: breakingwoman 'screamed for help ' after falling to bottom of cliff in purbeck
text: a woman had to scream for help after falling to the bottom of a cliff and becoming trapped .
the woman had been walking by old harry rocks in purbeck at about 07:40 gmt this morning when she fell down towards the bottom of the cliff .
the coastguard said another person heard screams coming from the bottom of the cliff and called for help .
lee-on-the-solent coastguard sent a helicopter to airlift to southampton general hospital .
her injuries are not currently known .
police , swanage coastguard and swanage lifeboat also attended the scene .

documents.title: motorist jailed for causing death of cyclist 'after popcorn throwing distraction '
text: a motorist has been jailed for causing the death of a cyclist after being distracted by her three children who were passengers in the car .

laura brayshaw pleaded guilty to causing death by careless driving after hitting 58-year-old richard ellis , from essex , on the a352 in worgret , dorset , on 3 april last year , after turning round to tell the youngest of her three daughters off for throwing popcorn , police said .
the 27-year-old , of queens road , portland , also admitted driving unfit through drugs in relation to a separate incident in august , officers added .
she was sentenced to 14 weeks in prison for causing death by careless driving and six weeks , consecutive , for driving unfit through drugs , and was also disqualified from driving for 20 months .

documents.title: waste sites ' one-day closures put back
text: plans to reduce opening hours at waste and recycling centres across hampshire have been put back by 10 months while the council seeks clarity from the government over diy waste fees .
it comes amid confusion after new fees for materials classed as `` diy construction waste '' came into force on 1 october last year .
the department for communities and local government ( dclg ) says diy waste from householders should be free to dispose of .
hampshire county council said reduced opening times , which had been due to start in january , will now be come into effect from october while it clarifies its legal position .
the charges , which still remain in place , range from £ 2.50 for a bag of soil , to £ 10 for a sheet of plasterboard .

documents.title: plans for seven new rail services between southampton and the capital
text: plans for seven new rail services between southampton and the capital

documents.title: 'he was my best friend '
text: laurence dowding said his son jack , who will be given a round of applause in tribute at tonight 's saints match , was his `` best friend '' .
he said : `` he was the best son you could ask for .
i have to do this for him , i get my strength from knowing it 's what he would have wanted me to do . ''
jack died on saturday at his home in hedge end after complications with his type 1 diabetes .

laurence added : `` if there 's anything i can do for jack and his memory i will , i hope this can raise at least a little bit of awareness for young people with diabetes to say if something is wrong tell people please .
`` i 've been amazed by the number of lives jack has touched .
i wanted to lock myself away after it happened but i know he will be rooting for me to keep going and he 'd tell me off if i did n't go to the match , this is all for him . ''

documents.title: saints fan who died of diabetes complications was 'amazing son '
text: the father of 20-year-old jack dowding , who died last week , has described his son as his `` best friend '' .
laurence dowding will be paying tribute to his son surrounded by saints fans tonight following the clap for jack campaign .
the campaign will see thousands in st mary 's stadium give jack a round of applause in the 20th minute of the efl cup match against liverpool tonight .
laurence said jack was a saints fanatic and he would be `` overwhelmed '' by the amount of people who have pulled together to remember him .

documents.title: in when snow last came to dorset
text: it 's been almost two years since dorset last had any significant snow but with the potential for the south coast to be covered in white tomorrow , we 've found some of our favourite reader 's from february 2015

documents.title: poole district car parking permit cost 'to more than double '
text: the cost of season tickets for some car parks in poole will more than double , a council has agreed .
annual permits in district car parks , which includes albert road ( and station approach , will rise from £ 225 to £ 500 and quarterly rates will increase from £ 70 to £ 150 .
increased charges for town centre car parks and beach areas were also unanimously approved by borough of poole 's cabinet on tuesday night .
campaigners have said the changes will damage the local economy .
the new charges will start on the 1 march .

documents.title: drivers warned as snow expected during rush hour tomorrow
text: drivers are being warned to be cautious on the roads on their journey home tomorrow afternoon .
snowfall is expected to start from about 16:00 gmt tomorrow .
road users are being urged to be careful as the roads are expected to become slippery after rainfall freezes and snow begins to fall .
here is a from the last time snow feel in dorset , when a car rolled on to its side on the icy roads in park hill in charlton marshall .

documents.title: saints to face liverpool in first leg of efl cup semi-final
text: southampton will be facing liverpool tonight at home in the first leg of the efl cup semi-final .
fans are hopeful for a win as saints have not reached the league cup final since a 1979 defeat by nottingham forest .
the club will be without captain jose fonte after he put in a transfer request last week and saints boss claude puel does not intend to include the defender until after the transfer window closes .
saints were thrashed 6-1 by liverpool in last season 's league cup quarter-finals and drew 0-0 with them at st mary 's in the premier league in november .
liverpool playmaker philippe coutinho could return for the match after nearly seven weeks out with ankle ligament damage .
captain jordan henderson misses out because of a heel injury .

documents.title: it 's beginning to look a lot like snow !
text: the south coast is set to be covered in snow tomorrow afternoon .
this morning bbc weather presenter holly green showed how the weather will suddenly change , with snow coming in from the west and covering the region by 16:00 gmt .

documents.title: family to pay 'emotional ' tribute to saints fanatic at match tonight
text: it 's set to be an emotional match for the family of 20-year-old jack dowding tonight .
the young saints fan died last week at his hedge end home following complications with type 1 diabetes .
now the family and southampton football club are coming together to pay a special tribute to the loyal fan .

in the 20th minute of the efl cup semi-final match against liverpool tonight , which kicks off at 19:45 , everyone inside st mary 's stadium will be encouraged to join in a round of applause for jack .
our thoughts are with jack 's family and friends .
we encourage # saintsfc fans to join in a round of applause in the 20th minute on wednesday .

documents.title: southampton bargate plan gets green light
text: plans to demolish the bargate shopping centre in southampton have been approved .
shops , more than 150 flats and student accommodation are planned for the queensway and east street area .
about 10 businesses face having to relocate under the proposals .
work could start in the autumn with the scheme expected to take two years to complete .

documents.title: cctv released after man stabbed in chest in southampton
text: footage has been released following a serious assault in southampton .
police are calling for anyone who recognises anyone in this video to get in touch after the assault on monday at about 01:00 gmt .
a man in his 30s suffered a stab wound to his chest in golden grove during the attack and his injuries are not considered life threatening .
a 29-year-old man from southampton has been arrested on sus of causing grievous bodily harm and bailed until 27 march .
the video shows the surrounding areas on the night of the assault , including old northam road , st mary street , and clifford street .

documents.title: southern drivers ' strike enters day two
text: southern drivers ' strike enters day two

documents.title: thomson closing gap on vendee leader
text: sailor alex thomson remains in the hunt to make history as the first briton to win the vendee globe round-the-world race .
thomson , whose hugo boss racing team are based in gosport , continues to close the gap on current leader armel le cleac'h in the closing stages .
thomson , 42 , was less than 100 miles behind frenchman le cleac'h to the south west of cape verde islands as the pair head for western france .
his team back at base in hampshire are also preparing to head for the finish line to welcome him .

documents.title: today 's weather : windy and cold , but mainly dry
text: after a cloudy start , patchy rain will soon clear to the south east .
it will become brighter and windier through the day with increasing wind chill and the chance of a few showers , but many areas are likely to remain dry .
highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
tonight any showers will die away through the evening to leave a dry rest of the night .
breezy conditions will remain , with a frost in sheltered spots .
minimum temperatures of 3c ( 37f ) .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to local live for dorset , hampshire and the isle of wight .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news from across the three counties .
you can get in touch via email , on our hampshire and dorset facebook pages or on twitter @ bbc hampshire and @ bbcdorset .
